data.text: @tripperhead This is so bad, so many unnecessary deaths, if only more of us got vaccinated

@tripperhead Mr Leung I am afraid you and your masters are utter morons if you are allowing understaffing of critical services and risking lives because of supposed close contact. 

Daily RAT test is the blindingly obvious answer.

@jahardman @tripperhead better ask our nonsense gov't ~ since 1997 nonstop cut budget on relate medical, even Medical Doctors. 
And, many penalties under 599G already.

@tripperhead @jahardman someone told me they had a 6 minute wait to be connected to 999 operators last night- there is another number direct to FSD control 2735 3355 if urgent need (can’t imagine being on hold for 6 minutes if medical emergency….)
@jahardman Dunno the answer to either, but I hope there's a triage system for ambulances.
@tripperhead Are there penalties for people who call ambulances unnecessarily? Or do operators triage 999 calls attempting to send ambulances to those most in need？
@tripperhead Because there has been an epic failure in basic risk, emergency and crisis management

@paulpask @tripperhead No official guidelines. HA still stratifying by risk. But departmental guidelines differs and are changing daily. In short - everything is a mess, you can fight for n95 and if your boss is understanding, you get one.
@dunsa123456 @tripperhead The one time I had to go to A&E I walked... 🤣
